intro: Alectorolophus goniotrichus, commonly known as the Cape dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features soft, hairy stems and leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Its bright yellow flowers are typically arranged in a single head, surrounded by bracts. Alectorolophus goniotrichus is known for its adaptability to arid conditions and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
